algorithm_technique: Monotonic stack to track increasing non-zero elements and count operations.
Greedy approach: zero out the minimum non-zero element in a subarray.
problem_summary_simple: Convert all array elements to zero using subarray operations on the minimum non-zero element.
problem_summary_technical: A monotonic stack efficiently counts operations by identifying segments that need to be zeroed out.
key_insights: The problem can be reframed as finding the number of distinct non-zero values encountered in increasing order.
A monotonic increasing stack helps identify when a new operation is needed (when a larger number appears after smaller ones).
Each time a new, larger minimum is encountered, a new operation is required for that segment.
